Extract inverse metric (mass matrix)

Source: R/fit.R
fit-method-inv_metric.Rd

Extract the inverse metric (mass matrix) for each chain.

Usage

$inv_metric(matrix = TRUE)

Arguments

  • matrix: (logical) Should a list of matrices be returned? By default a list of matrices is always returned, even if a diagonal metric was used when fitting the model. If a diagonal metric was used then setting matrix=FALSE will return a list of vectors instead, which uses less memory.

Value

A list of length equal to the number of MCMC chains. See the matrix argument for details.

See also

CmdStanMCMC

Examples

# \dontrun{
fit <- cmdstanr_example("logistic")
#> Model executable is up to date!
fit$inv_metric()
#> [[1]]
#>           [,1]      [,2]      [,3]      [,4]
#> [1,] 0.0489704 0.0000000 0.0000000 0.0000000
#> [2,] 0.0000000 0.0565619 0.0000000 0.0000000
#> [3,] 0.0000000 0.0000000 0.0505927 0.0000000
#> [4,] 0.0000000 0.0000000 0.0000000 0.0765553
#> 
#> [[2]]
#>           [,1]      [,2]      [,3]      [,4]
#> [1,] 0.0464694 0.0000000 0.0000000 0.0000000
#> [2,] 0.0000000 0.0502202 0.0000000 0.0000000
#> [3,] 0.0000000 0.0000000 0.0505695 0.0000000
#> [4,] 0.0000000 0.0000000 0.0000000 0.0764519
#> 
#> [[3]]
#>           [,1]      [,2]      [,3]      [,4]
#> [1,] 0.0508438 0.0000000 0.0000000 0.0000000
#> [2,] 0.0000000 0.0673253 0.0000000 0.0000000
#> [3,] 0.0000000 0.0000000 0.0560788 0.0000000
#> [4,] 0.0000000 0.0000000 0.0000000 0.0788151

#> [[4]]
#>           [,1]      [,2]      [,3]      [,4]

#> [3,] 0.0000000 0.0000000 0.0553186 0.0000000
#> [4,] 0.0000000 0.0000000 0.0000000 0.0710309

fit$inv_metric(matrix=FALSE)
#> [[1]]

fit <- cmdstanr_example("logistic", metric = "dense_e")
#> Model executable is up to date!
fit$inv_metric()
